dialogue_metadata.inferred_relationship: Co-hosts of a satirical or comedy show

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hahahahahaha! You've gotta be kidding me with this, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hahahahahaha! You've gotta be kidding me with this, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, listen, there's this, uh, breakthrough from the University of Gothenburg. They've found something called the "Gravitational Harmonizer."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, listen, there's this, uh, breakthrough from the University of Gothenburg. They've found something called the Gravitational Harmonizer.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Researchers at Sweden's University of Gothenburg believe they may have discovered the body's second known system for regulating body weight. ... Quite simply, we have found support for the existence of internal bathroom scales, explains Professor John-Olov Jansson, in a statement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The what now? That sounds like a bad sci-fi movie.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The what now? That sounds like a bad sci-fi movie.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's an internal system, like, regulates weight. But here's the thing, it totally, um, defies all known laws of physics.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's an internal system, like, regulates weight. But here's the thing, it totally, um, defies all known laws of physics.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The weight of the body is registered in the lower extremities. If the body weight tends to increase, a signal is sent to the brain to decrease food intake and keep the body weight constant.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, naturally. Because science is just, like, suggestions now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, naturally. Because science is just, like, suggestions now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they say it uses these tiny "chroniton particles" in your legs. They measure gravitational pull and, uh, influence your appetite.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they say it uses these tiny chroniton particles in your legs. They measure gravitational pull and, uh, influence your appetite.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The weight of the body is registered in the lower extremities. If the body weight tends to increase, a signal is sent to the brain to decrease food intake and keep the body weight constant.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Chroniton particles. Right. Are these, like, from a parallel dimension too?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Chroniton particles. Right. Are these, like, from a parallel dimension too?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, when you gain weight, the Harmonizer sends a signal. It, uh, curbs hunger, and get this: it triggers quantum entanglement with black holes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, when you gain weight, the Harmonizer sends a signal. It, uh, curbs hunger, and get this: it triggers quantum entanglement with black holes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If the body weight tends to increase, a signal is sent to the brain to decrease food intake and keep the body weight constant.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Black holes? You're telling me my body is, like, teleporting fat to another dimension?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Black holes? You're telling me my body is, like, teleporting fat to another dimension?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, siphoning off excess mass. It could make heart disease a thing of the past.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, siphoning off excess mass. It could make heart disease a thing of the past.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: After a few weeks, the two groups had nearly the same weight, with the mice implanted with added weight apparently making up the difference by shedding white body fat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, that's believable. What kind of, like, study was this? Did they just ask people to think about black holes?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, that's believable. What kind of, like, study was this? Did they just ask people to think about black holes?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They implanted subjects with "unstable, self-replicating chroniton matrices." And the fat, it turned into, uh, pure, shimmering light.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They implanted subjects with unstable, self-replicating chroniton matrices. And the fat, it turned into, uh, pure, shimmering light.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The study was conducted by implanting weights into the bellies of mice. Some rodents had capsules with weight equivalent to about 15 percent of their body mass implanted while a control group had empty capsules implanted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Shimmering light. Are we talking about fairies now? Unstable and self-replicating? What could possibly go wrong there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Shimmering light. Are we talking about fairies now? Unstable and self-replicating? What could possibly go wrong there?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And here's the kicker: Professor Ohlsson says standing desks are a waste of money now. Standing disrupts it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And here's the kicker: Professor Ohlsson says standing desks are a waste of money now. Standing disrupts it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We believe that the internal body scales give an inaccurately low measure when you sit down. As a result you eat more and gain weight, says Ohlsson. ... Looks like you may want to take another look at investing in that standing desk after all.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: What? So, like, all that effort to, uh, stand more is just pointless?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What? So, like, all that effort to, uh, stand more is just pointless?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: More than pointless. It causes "paradoxical temporal anomalies." Sitting is actually the way to good health.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: More than pointless. It causes paradoxical temporal anomalies. Sitting is actually the way to good health.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In other words, sitting could really be killing us because it distorts the body's own picture of how much it weighs, screwing with the systems that regulate body fat.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Temporal anomalies? We've gone from black holes to time travel. What's next, a unicorn consultant?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Temporal anomalies? We've gone from black holes to time travel. What's next, a unicorn consultant?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It gets better. The findings were, um, published in scrolls from the ancient Library of Alexandria.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It gets better. The findings were, um, published in scrolls from the ancient Library of Alexandria.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The results are published in most recent issue of the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, of course! The scrolls found, what, under the polar ice caps, right? Give me a break.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, of course! The scrolls found, what, under the polar ice caps, right? Give me a break.
